document_title: Meningococcal meningitis: Signs, causes, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_content:
Meningococcal meningitis in children, if not treated promptly, can cause many dangerous complications, even death. These complications are divided into two groups:
Early complications include: Increased intracranial pressure; Disseminated intravascular coagulation; Convulsions appear; Circulatory collapse; Organ failure; Increased intracranial pressure;; Disseminated intravascular coagulation;; Appearance of convulsions;; Circulatory collapse;; Organ failure; Late complications include: Deafness; Blind; Prolonged neurological impairment; Poor brain development, reduced IQ; Severe necrosis leads to amputation; Deaf;; Blind;; Prolonged neurological impairment;; Poor brain development, reduced IQ;; Severe necrosis leads to amputation.
